words.definition: A coach is a person who teaches sports.
words.example: My coach gets very excited during games.

words.definition: To control something is to make it do what you want.
words.example: To control the TV, just push the buttons.

words.definition: A description of someone or something says what they are like.
words.example: I gave a description of the man to the police.

words.definition: If something is direct, it goes straight between two places.
words.example: The green path is a direct route to my house.

words.definition: An exam is a test.
words.example: I did some practice questions for the math exam.

words.definition: An example of something is a thing that is typical of it.
words.example: Cola is an example of a soft drink.

words.definition: A limit is the largest or smallest amount of something that you allow.
words.example: My mother put a limit on how much I could use the phone.

words.definition: If something is local, it is nearby.
words.example: The local market sells all the food we need.

words.definition: Magical describes something that uses magic.
words.example: The wand was magical.

words.definition: Mail is the letters and packages that you receive.
words.example: I get a lot of mail every day.

words.definition: A novel is a long story in a book.
words.example: I read a novel over the weekend.

words.definition: An outline is a plan for a story or report.
words.example: I wrote an outline for my book.

words.definition: A poet is a person who writes poems.
words.example: William Shakespeare was a famous poet.

words.definition: To print is to put words or images on paper.
words.example: Make sure you print your name clearly.

words.definition: A scene is a part of a movie or book.
words.example: A scary scene happened in the movie.

words.definition: A sheet is a thin, flat piece of paper.
words.example: I only needed a single sheet of paper.

words.definition: If someone is silly, they show a lack of thought.
words.example: I made a silly mistake.

words.definition: A store is a place where you buy things.
words.example: I went to the store to buy some food.

words.definition: To suffer is to feel pain or sadness.
words.example: He suffered from a bad headache.

words.definition: Technology is new machines and ways of doing things.
words.example: He loves new technology.
